p: Compound 6a was prepared from benzaldehyde 4a (0.047 g, 0.44 mmol), 2–(3,4-diaminophenyl)-3,4,5,6-tetrahydropyrimidin-1-ium chloride 3 (0.100 g, 0.44 mmol), and sodium metabisulfite (0.084 g, 0.44 mmol) in dimethyl sulfoxide (0,8 ml). The resulting free base was converted into salt as described below to obtained 0.040 g (29.0%) of beige powder; m.p. >300 °C; 1H NMR (300 MHz, DMSO- d 6) δ 10.22 (s, 2H), 8.47 − 8.45 (m, 2H), 8.19 (s, 1H), 7.94 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.76 (d, J = 8.4 Hz, 1H), 7.69 (s, 3H), 3.53 (m, 4H), 2.02 (m, 2H); 13 C NMR (75 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 159.3, 152.7, 132.2, 129.3, 127.7, 123.8, 123.2, 115.0, 38.8, 17.7; Analysis calcd for C 17H 17ClN 4: C, 65.28; H, 5.48; N, 17.91%; Found: C, 65.14; H, 5.61; N, 17.99%.
